description.narrative: The PDO is to improve rural road connectivity in project districts, and enhance management of rural roads in Bihar.

condition.narrative: PA - Schedule - Section I.A.4: The Project Implementing Entity shall, and shall cause BRRDA, to carry out the ArtificialIntelligence Pilot, as agreed with the Association

PA Schedule, Section I, C, Clause 2(a) - The Project Implementing Entity shall prepare and furnish to the Association forconcurrence by no later than one (1) year after the Effective Date, a human resources professional development strategy (the "HumanResources Professional Development Strategy"), in a manner and substance acceptable to the Association.

PA Schedule, Section I, C, Clause 2(b) - The Project Implementing Entity shall prepare and furnish to the Association forconcurrence, by no later than six (6) months after the effective date, a safety action plan for Rural Roads (the "Rural RoadsSafety Action Plan'), in a manner and substance acceptable to the Association.

PA Schedule, Section I, C, Clause 2(c) - The Project Implementing Entity shall thereafter thereafter implement the Human ResourcesProfessional Development Strategy and the Rural Road Safety Action Plan as so approved, and timely provide the necessary resourcestherefor, as agreed with the Association.

Schedule, Section I, A, Clause 2(a) - The project implementing entity shall maintain throughout the period of Projectimplementation a high-level project steering committee headed by the Secretary of RWD and comprised of the Engineer in Chief (RWD),and four Chief Engineers of RWD with appropriate powers for policy guidance & exercise general oversight of the implementation ofthe project.

Schedule, Section I, A, Clause 2(b) - The project implementing entity shall maintain BRRDA in good standing and operationsthroughout the period of Project implementation and ensure that BRRDA: (i) is granted the powers, functions, competencies, staffand resources agreed with the Association; and (ii) establishes and/or maintains adequate and qualified teams responsible for theproject under terms of reference agreed with Association.

Schedule, Section I, A, Clause 2(c) - The project implementing entity shall maintain throughout the period of implementation ofsuch civil works on any Rural Road, or section thereof, in any Project District, one or more district-specific ProjectImplementation Units ("PIU(s)"), comprising competent, experienced and qualified staff, in sufficient numbers and under terms ofreference acceptable to the Association.

Schedule, Section I, A, Clause 2(d) - The project implementing entity shall maintain throughout the period of Projectimplementation, a road sector modernization group, which group shall: (i) be headed by the Secretary of RWD, and comprised of RWDofficers and recognized road/transport sector experts; and (ii) oversee, and provide guidance to the RWD and BRRDA on theimplementation of Component 2 of the Project.

Schedule, Section I, A, Clause 2(e) - The project implementing entity shall maintain, throughout the period of Projectimplementation, a road safety management group, which group shall: (i) be headed by the Secretary of RWD, and comprised ofrepresentatives from the Bihar's State Police, the Transport Department, the Education Department and the Health Department; and(ii) oversee the implementation of Component 2(c) of the Project.

Schedule, Section I, A, Clause 3 - The Project Implementing Entity shall cause BRRDA to select and engage by no later than eight(8) months after the Effective Date, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of implementation of the Project, the servicesof a project management consulting firm or a group of individual experts in order to assist the RWD and BRRDA, inter alia, withProject implementation, monitoring, the carrying out of performance audits and provision of ancillary technical support.

Schedule, Section I, D, Clause 1(a) - The Project Implementing Entity shall carry out the Project in accordance with the EMF, theECoPs, the SMF, the VF, and the instruments (to be) prepared pursuant to paragraph 2(b) of this Section I.D in consistency with theobjectives, policies, procedures, time schedules, compensation arrangements and other provisions set forth in the EMF, the ECoPs,the SMF and the VF, and in a manner and substance satisfactory to the Association (all these documents collectively referred to asthe "Safeguard Documents').

Schedule, Section I, F(b) - The Project Implementing Entity shall allocate at least eighty percent (80%) of the Rural Roadsmaintenance funds referred to in sub-paragraph (a) above in accordance with the maintenance priorities established under the annualmaintenance plans prepared under the Asset Management Plan. The Project Implementing Entity shall publicly disclose the annualmaintenance plans in RWD's web-site, in a manner and substance acceptable to the Association.

title.narrative: Road Safety improvement scheme related audits undertaken on priority roads
Network level climate vulnerability assessment undertaken with special focus on floods
RWD staff received at least six (6) weeks of professional training during the entire project duration.
Improved effectiveness of project expenditure - Project roads designed using cost-effective measures.
Improved quality of built Infrastructure - Project roads delivered with satisfactory quality certified through independent qualityreviews
Roads in good and fair condition as a share of total classified roads
Length of roads subject to planned maintenance contracting
Pilot AI based system in districts within the state
